channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WY
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WY

item.title: Report E-2023060099
item.description:
Report E-2023060099

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-08T15:09:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-01
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISITICS
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of coil cleaner (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner poly 1 gallon bottles had released 0.5 gallons of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.

item.title: Report X-2023050783
item.description:
Report X-2023050783

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-08T15:09:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-04
  • City: CASPER
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: driver brought the package back at the end of his day. noted there is moisture on the bottom of the box. i took the box and placed it in a red hazardous spill tote and performed a hazardous materials damage inspection. after that was done i placed it in our hazmat cage and awaiting disposition. driver stated box had been leaking when it was taken out. unsure how damage happened. DescribePack: there is a very small leak. there is a dent on the bottom of the drum where it looks like it was dropped on. there is a tiny crack along the inside of the rim. my assumtion this is where the crack is and the leak coming from. DurationRel: 8 and MitigateEffect: placed box and drum in a plastic bag in a red hazmat tote

item.title: Report X-2023050062
item.description:
Report X-2023050062

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-08T15:09:30+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-04-30
  • City: SHERIDAN
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: BNSF RAILWAY COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: CBFX 304955 was involved in an in-yard derailment in the Sheridan, WY yard. Due to the derailment, the hopper car was laid over on its side and the top loading hatch opened up, causing the release of product. The product on the ground was cleaned up and the car will require a transload of the remaining product inside.

item.title: Report E-2023010570
item.description:
Report E-2023010570

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-27
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal UWY experienced a release of UN3378 Provox C from a 55-pound paper bag. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released to a 1' x 1' area of the dock floor due to improper loading. The damaged bag and released product were collected into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2023010147
item.description:
Report E-2023010147

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-01-09
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1245 ET, XPO logistics terminal UWY called to report a release of UN1813 Potassium Hydroxide, that released inside of trailer #3118088, due to a forklift puncture. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 1-pound of product released to the trailer floor in a 1' x 1' area due to a forklift puncture. The damaged bags and all released product were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022090264
item.description:
Report E-2022090264

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-08
  • City: EVANSVILLE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Logiflex
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 8, 2022, at 1549 ET, Logiflex reported 5-gallons of UN2735 "Accelerator 960-1 CH" impacting the trailer floor and asphalt parking lot from (40) 5-gallon jugs due to falling over and having loose caps. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response Inc. (HMRI) to the site to perform all clean up operations. On September 8, 2022, at 2021 ET, HMRI arrived onsite and offloaded the trailer. HMRI estimated approximately 5-gallons of product released impacting the trailer floor and asphalt below. HMRI stated that the trailer will be taken to a truck wash once the clean up was completed, applied granular absorbents to the impacted areas, collected and containerized the absorbents into a 30-gallon poly drum. All waste was transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090169
item.description:
Report E-2022090169

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-09-06
  • City: CASPER
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: LOGIFLEX INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On September 7, 2022, at 1730 ET, Logiflex reported 10-gallons of UN2735 "Accelerator 960-1 CH" released impacting the inside of the trailer and gravel from (40) 5-gallon plastic jugs due to falling over and having loose caps. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response Inc. (HMRI) to the site to perform all onsite clean up operations. On September 7, 2022, at 2320 ET, HMRI arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 10-gallons of product released impacting the inside of the trailer and on product containers 6-feet (ft.) by 6ft., the outside of the trailer 4-ft. by 50-ft. and the gravel area beneath the passenger side of the rear axel 2-ft. by 2-ft. HMRI cleaned inside and outside of the trailer with a pressure washer, degreaser, and citric acid collected with a collapsible vinyl container. HMRI collected the impacted gravel with hand shovels, less than one inch in depth. HMRI collected and containerized solid waste liquids solidified with granular absorbents into (1) 55-gallon poly drum. All waste was transported offsite for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2022090568
item.description:
Report E-2022090568

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-08-31
  • City: CHEYENNE
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: At 1054 EST, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release of approximately 2 gallons of HAI-404M in trailer # 3115404 due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer's surface and splashed on nearby freight. ERTS dispatched Haz-Mat Response to conduct cleanup. At 1322 ET, HMR personnel arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 gallons of product released to a 3' x 3" area of the trailer floor. The product was transferred from the damaged tote into a new one. Absorbents were worked into the impacted areas and all impacted freight wiped down. The damaged tote was then cut up and containerized along with all cleanup debris into a 95 gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.title: Report E-2022080248
item.description:
Report E-2022080248

Identified by scraper @ 2023-06-07T21:08:36+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2022-07-04
  • City: FORT BRIDGER
  • State: WY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: COCA-COLA CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On July 4, 2022, at 1339 ET, Coca-Cola Ft. Worth reported a release of UN1805 Phosphoric acid impacting the inside of the trailer and under the trailer from a 5-gallon poly pail due to a load shift. ERTS dispatched Lincoln Environmental to preform all onsite clean up operations. On July 4 2022, at 2230 ET Lincoln Environmental arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-gallons of product released to a 10-feet (ft.) by 6-inch (in.) area of the trailer floor. Lincoln Environmental placed oil dri on the impacted area. Lincoln Environmental collected and containerized the impacted absorbents into a 20-gallon poly drum. All waste was taken off-site for disposal.
